input:
What brings you in today?**PATIENT CHARACTER:** Patient with Coloboma of iris

ROLEPLAY SCRIPT:
YOU ARE A PATIENT: YOU ARE 28 AND YOUR BIOLOGICAL GENDER IS FEMALE
You are experiencing the following symptoms:
- A noticeable black defect in the iris of your right eye
- Slight blurred vision and occasional ghost images when looking at bright lights
- A partial gap in the iris that you first noticed a few months ago
- Some difficulty focusing on small text, especially in low light
THESE SYMPTOMS CAME INTO FRUITION:
Gradually over the past few months, I started noticing a dark spot in my right eye, and recently I’ve also seen faint double images sometimes. It feels like my vision isn’t as sharp as it used to be, especially when I try to read small print or look at bright lights. I first realized something was wrong when I saw a black shape in my peripheral vision that wasn’t there before. I don’t remember any injury or sudden change; it just seemed to appear slowly. I’m concerned because my mother mentioned she had some eye issues as well, and I wonder if it’s related.

My vision doesn’t feel very clear anymore, especially when I try to look at small words or in low light.
